text:
.@SteveBakerHW is one of the original Brexiteers. He campaigned to 'take back control' and 'sovereignty for our parliament'.

He now thinks that asking our sovereign parliament to vote on different options to resolve the #Brexit crisis is, "a national humiliation".
Beyond parody.
author: Alewin7

text: More chance of a Keaton Jennings recall for first Ashes Test...
author: Alewin7

text: Heroes!
author: Alewin7

text: I'd rather win a referendum and win a big mandate to #Remain.
author: Alewin7

text:
EU27 have pitched their response perfectly.
Message to Theresa May, we won't let you put a gun to the heads of MPs.
Message to the rest of parliament, you have two weeks to come together and agree a way forward.
Let's make it a #PeoplesVote.
author: Alewin7

text:
Our priority must to be to get #KyleWilson through & win a clear mandate for #Remain.
But if on the 28th or 29th, it comes to a choice between No Deal or Revoke, it's no choice at all.
Anyone who votes for No Deal would knowingly risk medicine shortages.
author: Alewin7

text:
Few folks tweeting May's statement will have resonated with public.
Even if it did, it is irrelevant. First rule of communications: know your audience.
The only audience that matters is MPs, she needs their votes.
She spent the entire day attacking MPs and then doubled down on it
author: Alewin7

text:
Theresa May is blackmailing parliament and the country into backing a #Brexit deal that will make our country poorer and more insular.

For two #Labour MPs pick this moment to try and give her a lifeline is so wrong. 
Hope and expect there will be no support for the amendment.
author: Alewin7

text:
Or Article 50 revoked.
Say there are 24 hours to go and May's deal has been rejected, do you really think there are more votes for No Deal than revoke?
author: Alewin7

text:
Countless scenarios between now and Friday 29th, but if Macron holds firm & A50 extension is vetoed...
1. Weds 27th, Commons votes down MV3 
2. Thursday 28th, Commons votes down No Deal, but it remains default, so...
3. Emergency session of parliament. Commons votes to revoke A50
author: Alewin7

text:
1,000 days since the referendum.
Brief update on #Brexit progress...
author: Alewin7

text:
Translation: we are a week from crashing out of the EU, but avoiding  a fight with Fox, Grayling and Leadsom is still more important to Theresa May.
It is party over country for her. It always has been and I suspect it always will be.
author: Alewin7

text:
Thank you @bbclaurak and team #Brexitcast, you are helping to keep us sane!
I think it's a toss up between the klaxon and John Bercow bellowing, "division, clear the lobbies" 
for the sound of 2019!
author: Alewin7

text:
Proud to sign this and grateful to formidable @Fionafof for being the driving force behind it.

A small number of #Labour MPs still back #Brexit, hopefully not for much longer.
Those who do need to come clean and say what they will cut to make it happen.
author: Alewin7

text:
**Puts neck on line with #Brexit prediction**
Defies belief that EU27 would look at this parliament, this government and this PM and say...
Yes, it has been a rocky couple of years, but we're sure you can get it all sorted by June.
Surely we are looking at a two year extension.
author: Alewin7

text:
The Prime Minister has been in office for 979 days...
It might just be time to take some personal responsibility.
author: Alewin7

text:
This is a landmark achievement for @ClarionFutures and we're proud of it.
HAs are about so much more than bricks and mortar, we invest in communities and we invest in people.
#UKhousing
author: Alewin7

text:
Brilliant initiative from @Fionafof, a friend and a tireless Labour campaigner.
She met #Labour MPs outside of the PLP meeting tonight, to ask the minority who still support #Brexit what policies they would sacrifice to make it happen...
author: Alewin7

text:
**Liam Fox has succeded in maintaining the status quo with Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein**

At the same time we will be leaving the single market and Customs Union, meaning far worse trade terms with 27 EU countries and 450 million people.

**Well done again @LiamFox**
author: Alewin7

text:
So, how long until the unpublished Boris article appears? 
You know, the one entitled: "This isn't the deal we need, but I'll back it to keep battling for Britain"
CC @ShippersUnbound
author: Alewin7
